Description: Fragment of Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Flattened handle, gradual curve. Rectangular stamp. Clay medium pink-beige; mixed inclusions; cream slip.
Curator's comments: Petrie drew three such stamps (Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 55.,5, 110, 6 and 201, 50). From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0920.11. Same die as on BM 1955,0920.69, which has a second stamp.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1620)
